titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Arthur W. Arndt Collection, early 18th century-1873

profiledesc.creation: Original EAD encoding by Jessi Fishman according to TARO 2 EAD 2002 Editing Instructions. March 2008

did.head: Descriptive Summary

extref.corpname: Dolph Briscoe Center for American History,The University of Texas at Austin

did.abstract: This collection, presented by Rev. Arthur W. Arndt, pastor of St. Paul's Lutheran Church of Serbin in 1964, relates to the Wendish colony eastablished in 1854 in what is now Lee County, Texas. Ranging from the early 18th century to 1873, items in the collection provide documentation of the Wendish migrations, motivated primarily by religious persecution in Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection, presented by Rev. Arthur W. Arndt, pastor of St. Paul's Lutheran Church of Serbin in 1964, relates to the Wendish colony eastablished in 1854 in what is now Lee County, Texas. Ranging from the early 18th century to 1873, items in the collection provide documentation of the Wendish migrations, motivated primarily by religious persecution in Germany. Included are bibles, prayer books, hymnals, catechisms, and other materials used in religious instruction of the colony.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Arthur W. Arndt Collection, early 18th century-1873, Dolph Briscoe Center for American History, The University of Texas at Austin.
